page.title: 03CHAWTON SERVICES
page.content: Villagers have water, gas, electricity and mains drainage, introduced about 1981. A souvenir shop and tearooms cater for tourists. A hairdressers shop attracts men, women and children from other villages and Alton. Like- wise The Greyfriar public house. There is a good daily bus service along the A31 and A32 main roads. Twice a week a private company comes via Chawton to Alton. Two postal deliveries and collections Mon. to Saturday. Milk is delivered except 0n Sundays. Dustbins are emptied weekly. There is one public telephone kiosk. A county council mobile library van visits fortnightly.
